彼陽的晚意，初生的東曦；美目的顧耳，似暮的篝壁。溫柔是你的夢，宛如少女的夢，但我扯碎你夢的翅膀，並闡述你的夢；我騎上尤熱烈的馬，來摩洛哥城堡。似瑪瑙潭，檸檬酸了，暖夢熟了；檸檬睡了，暖夢死了。未成熟難夢到愁般，笙變，失敗，傷悲……絲般暖夢似樂，溺夢愁編。

暴雪，我日你仙人，给句痛快话，你妈什么时候似？？

I have a lot to say about this game now that its on Steam. I think its important to first mention that I am a very easy person to please. Until now, I have never posted a negative review, I avoid toxicity, and I don't follow bandwagons when it comes to disliking pieces of media. For example, I quite enjoy the Star Wars sequel trilogy despite what the apparent vocal majority says about them. I don't need a piece of media to be faultless the same way I don't need every meal I eat to be a Michelin Star entree. I enjoy most things because most things made to be enjoyed are at least somewhat enjoyable. I'm telling you this so you know that this review is a product of my own frustrations and disappointments that led me to completely drop what used to be one of my favorite games.

I was a bit late to the Overwatch party as I started playing about 2 years after the launch of Overwatch 1. During those 2 years I was busy at college and didn't have a good enough PC to enjoy it even if I did have the time. But the community was still plenty large when I joined, and I quickly had a blast learning the mechanics and playstyle of each hero, learning how to read the game to inform my decisions, and as a result I went from being pretty garbage at the game to comfortably mediocre. I was never a particularly competitive player, but I was strong enough at a couple heroes that I play with friends who were both much stronger players than me and much weaker players than me and still have lots of fun in either situation. 

On top of that, I grew to really appreciate the worldbuilding that had gone into the backstory. Although the actual gameplay showcased very little of the story aside from the characters, the cinematics that they released on youtube were fantastically animated, voice acted, and had some amazing stories. Each one helped give the admittedly sparse gameplay of the first game a little more depth and character, and helped it feel unique when compared to all the other online shooters with no single player gameplay. Previously, despite being a mostly single-player gamer, I had really enjoyed TF2 for similar reasons. The two games often got compared as they were both class-based shooters with a lot of personality in the characters. This was the biggest aspect of the game that drew me in as a player, and I was really hopeful that more would be added to the gameplay to take advantage of all the effort they had put into the background story.

But shortly after this time, new content began to dry up as development shifted over to work on the sequel, Overwatch 2. Overwatch 2 promised to add in more story features, fix a lot of the balancing issues of the first game, and make an all round improved version of the first game. I was excited, but I was still enjoying the first game in the meantime. I was able to put aside the lack of new content and unbalanced gameplay knowing that they would likely be much better soon. But of course, that is not what happened.

You shouldn't need me to tell you what did happen. I don't want to go into the details of the Activision/Blizzard scandal, or the insane management shift, or the diversity tool controversy, or the "sexual harrassment simulator", or the nail in the coffin that was the PvE changes. You can read about these yourself and hopefully come to the conclusion that this game isn't worth supporting in the slightest. What I do want to answer is this: despite all of those awful things that happened, is Overwatch 2 at the very least a fun and rewarding game?

No. Not at all. Overwatch 2 managed to kill any and all enjoyment I had for the first game.

 It should have been so easy. They had an amazing backstory, amazing characters, great gameplay, a dedicated fanbase, etc, etc. All they had to do was invest more in their strengths and not make things worse. And of course, they did the opposite. They took away a lot of what made the first game fun (tank hero comps, the ability for everyone to play the same heroes, access to all maps) and gave us a pay-to-win, toxic mess that was even more unbalanced than before. Almost none of the features they promised were delivered. They made the strongest heroes the ones that were only available with a premium battepass or after an unreasonable amount of playtime for your average person. They made it essentially impossible to get cosmetics you wanted without paying actually ludicrous prices ($20 for a slightly different set of clothes???). AND on top of all of that, they managed to prove that they are without a doubt one of the slimiest, least likeable companies on the planet.

There is no excuse. I have personally sworn to never touch this game or another game from Blizzard again. The bones of an enjoyable free to play game may still be there, and who knows, maybe things will actually start improving in the future, but given how much people have complained with no clear signs of change, I'm doubtful of even that. I beg you, find another game to play, I suggest TF2 as it has similar gameplay, is free to play, and you won't hate yourself for playing it. Avoid this mess at all costs, and mourn the loss of something great to greed and toxicity. Thanks for the fun times you gave me, but I am done.

[h1] 🎮 Обращение к фанатам TF2, которые хейтят данную игру и пишут отрицательные обзоры.[/h1]

Фанаты TF, пипец вы агрессивные... Запомните уже, что Ваша игра не единственная в данном жанре. И хейтить похожую по жанру игру - тупо и глупо. Я соглашусь с аргументированными отзывами, где пишут про (донатные скины, battle pass, просранный PVE режим). Но, если вспомнить, то сам TF2 держится на комьюнити, и в самой игре нет поддержки разработчиков.

 Мне лично TF2 не понравилась, но я почему-то её не хейчу и не поливаю говном в отзывах и на каждом шагу. Почему нельзя быть добрым и относится к другим играм по этому жанру - нормально? Я вот этого не понимаю.

Будь-те просто добрее и получайте от игр - удовольствие. 




[h1] 📍 Мнение о Overwatch 2: [/h1]
Мнение у меня положительное. Игра получилась красивой, оптимизированной и прикольной. Персонажей в игре много, и у каждого персонажа разные способы атаки и разная ульта. Все персонажи выглядят красиво, и на каждого из них есть скины. Конечно-же они за донат, но и без доната можно получать скины (хоть и не так много, но можно). Но, в игру можно играть и без скинов (скины ничего не решают в игре). Карт в игре достаточно, есть несколько режимов.

[h1]📌 Итог: [/h1]
Знаю эту игру ещё c 2017 года, но потом прекратил играть из-за того, что ПК перестал поддерживать игру (слишком слабый ПК был). И, честно я рад, что вторая часть Overwatch вышла в стим. В стиме куда удобнее, чем в Battle net. А, если говорить про саму игру, то она сделана качественно и красиво. Графика в игре красивая, озвучка персонажей прекрасная. Персонажей в игре много, и каждый сможет найти своего любимчика за которого будет легче побеждать.
